We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Business Operations and Finance Advisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Off Chevron Drive, Lekki -&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Work Hours: Monday - Friday | 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Job Summary


	We seek a motivated, proactive and detail-oriented Business Operations and Finance Advisor to join our dynamic team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day financial operations of the company&#39;s business by accurately recording transactions, assisting in reconciliations, maintaining accurate financial data and records in audit and compliance with regulatory standards.
	This role plays a key part in ensuring timely reporting, audit, compliance and operational transparency across departments.


Responsibilities
Includes but not limited to the following:


	Preparation of periodic reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual)
	Maintenance of accounts payable and receivable
	Engagement of clients on transactions and invoices
	Collaboration with the administrative, operations and procurement teams to ensure accurate financial tracking of purchases
	Maintenance and reporting of accurate financial data and records
	Overseeing the company&rsquo;s tax payments and other financial obligations
	Conducting audits and maintaining proper documentation for all transactions in line with local/international audit standards
	Ensuring compliance with all company, local, state, and federal accounting and financial policies, practices and regulations
	Assisting management in the decision-making process by preparing budgets and financial forecasts
	Providing direct support to the CEO and other departments as requested


Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in accounting or any related field
	Professional certification in Accounting (ICAN, ACCA etc.)


Work Experience and Competencies:
The ideal candidate must have:


	A minimum of five (5) years of experience in any Accounting or Finance role
	Demonstrated, advanced proficiency in MS Excel and Accounting software
	Strong numerical accuracy and attention to details
	Strong bookkeeping, research and analytical abilities
	Excellent written, verbal, communication and interpersonal skills.
	High integrity and be able to maintain confidentiality and be comfortable engaging senior management and external stakeholders.


Preferences:


	Resident on the Island (Ikoyi, VI, Lekki, Ajah, Sangotedo and environs).


Compensation and Benefits


	Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
	Career advancement opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their most current CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;recruitment@zenilum.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Business Operations &amp; Finance Advisor&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Business Operations and Finance Advisor Job at Zenilum Company Limited




        
    

        
        Zenilum Company Limited is an experienced consulting and research management company. We specialize in consulting, supply chain management, downhole services, well site services, upstream oil and gas production and engineering. Our primary areas of operation are West and East Africa. We endeavour to create a global brand by providing excellent services to our stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Operations and Finance Advisor

Job Location: Off Chevron Drive, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Work Hours: Monday - Friday | 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We seek a motivated, proactive and detail-oriented Business Operations and Finance Advisor to join our dynamic team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day financial operations of the company's business by accurately recording transactions, assisting in reconciliations, maintaining accurate financial data and records in audit and compliance with regulatory standards.
	This role plays a key part in ensuring timely reporting, audit, compliance and operational transparency across departments.


Responsibilities
Includes but not limited to the following:


	Preparation of periodic reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual)
	Maintenance of accounts payable and receivable
	Engagement of clients on transactions and invoices
	Collaboration with the administrative, operations and procurement teams to ensure accurate financial tracking of purchases
	Maintenance and reporting of accurate financial data and records
	Overseeing the company’s tax payments and other financial obligations
	Conducting audits and maintaining proper documentation for all transactions in line with local/international audit standards
	Ensuring compliance with all company, local, state, and federal accounting and financial policies, practices and regulations
	Assisting management in the decision-making process by preparing budgets and financial forecasts
	Providing direct support to the CEO and other departments as requested


Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	Bachelor’s degree in accounting or any related field
	Professional certification in Accounting (ICAN, ACCA etc.)


Work Experience and Competencies:
The ideal candidate must have:


	A minimum of five (5) years of experience in any Accounting or Finance role
	Demonstrated, advanced proficiency in MS Excel and Accounting software
	Strong numerical accuracy and attention to details
	Strong bookkeeping, research and analytical abilities
	Excellent written, verbal, communication and interpersonal skills.
	High integrity and be able to maintain confidentiality and be comfortable engaging senior management and external stakeholders.


Preferences:


	Resident on the Island (Ikoyi, VI, Lekki, Ajah, Sangotedo and environs).


Compensation and Benefits


	Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
	Career advancement opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their most current CV and cover letter to: recruitment@zenilum.com using “Business Operations & Finance Advisor” as the subject of the mail.

HR / Administrative Officer Job at Brands Optimal Limited




        
    

        
        Brands Optimal Limited is a leading experiential marketing agency. We are one of Africa’s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Administrative Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a talented HR / Admin. Officer to join our team.
	As an HR Officer, you will play a key role in the day-to-day operations of our Human Resources department.
	You'll be responsible for and support various HR functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, employee engagement, compliance, and general administration.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, screening, and scheduling interviews.
	Support onboarding and offboarding processes.
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases.
	Provide support with Learning & Development.
	Provide support with the implementation of organizational policies.
	Champion employee engagement and workplace culture initiatives.
	Prepare HR-related reports and documentation.
	Oversee HR administration and general administration.


Requirements and Skills


	A B.Sc. in Human Resource Management or a related field.
	2+ years of experience in an HR-related role.
	Candidate must hold a 2:1 degree or higher.
	Strong knowledge of employment legislation and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and maintain accuracy under pressure.
	A collaborative mindset and proactive attitude toward problem-solving and innovation.
	Highly organized with attention to detail and confidentiality.
	Proficient in MS Office.
	An HRM certification or similar is a plus.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Branch Manager, Retail Sales

	Develop and maintain strong relationships with retail customers.
	Market and cross-sell the bank's retail products and services.

	A first degree in a Business-related discipline (Master's/professional certification is an added advantage).

Benefits
 


	Opportunity to lead and grow within one of Nigeria's leading retail banks.

	Professional development and growth opportunities.
